name: Permanent
description:
Little X has solved the #P-complete problem in polynomial time recently. So he
gives this task to you. There is a special n × n matrix A, you should
calculate its permanent modulo 1000000007 (10^9 + 7). The special property of
matrix A is almost all its elements equal to 1. Only k elements have specified
value. You can find the definition of permanent at the link:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permanent Input The first line contains two
space-separated integers n, k (1 ≤ n ≤ 10^5; 1 ≤ k ≤ 50). The next k lines
contain the description of the matrix. The i-th line contains three space-
separated integers xi, yi, wi (1 ≤ xi, yi ≤ n; 0 ≤ wi ≤ 10^9). These numbers
denote that Axi, yi = wi. All the elements of the matrix except of the given
elements are equal to 1. It's guaranteed that all the positions (xi, yi) are
distinct. Output Print the permanent of the matrix modulo 1000000007 (10^9 +
7). Examples Input 3 1 1 1 2 Output 8 Input 10 10 3 3 367056794 6 2 124561273
1 3 46718146 6 9 415916869 10 5 985968336 3 1 526792265 1 4 386357058 10 4
349304187 2 7 102032499 3 6 502679075 Output 233333333
